result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Albert Dronso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with count 2 and 3; and consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; credit for 22 days (01-13-2015 to 02-03-2015) time served.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution set at ZERO.
AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No contact with Michael H.
No contact with Tanya G. 
No selling any items to pawn or resale shops or on the internet.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.

supervisions.notes:
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: concurrent with count 1 and 3; and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 22 days (01-13-2015 to 02-03-2015) days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Complete Batters Intervention Program.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with count 1 and 2; and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 22 days (01-13-2015 to 02-03-2015) days time served

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Bernadine D. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with count 2 and 3; and consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; credit for 22 days (01-13-2015 to 02-03-2015) time served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.  
- Restitution set at ZERO.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 and 3; and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 22 days (01-13-2015 to 02-03-2015) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Complete Batters Intervention Program.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 and 2; and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 22 days (01-13-2015 to 02-03-2015) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Seek/Maintain Full Time employment.
- No contact with Michael H.
- No contact with Tanya G. 
- No selling any items to pawn or resale shops or on the internet.

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in custody.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 06-12-2015 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Jeffrey Kremers. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department, pending sentencing.

Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
AS TO COUNT  1, 2, and 3 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 4-2-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Certified copies of case no. 15CF45, and case no. 14CF5521, received and filed.

Attorney Justin Singleton in court. Defendant is not present in Court. Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE.

Court orders conditions of 24 hour GPS monitoring be modified to allow Doctor's appointments that are verified by Justice Point.
Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing on 3-5-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Case held off the record for the purposes of Sentencing. Defense requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 3-5-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in custody.  Lindsey Anderson, student intern under the supervision of Ronald Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Adam Albert Dronso in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
